entries.doc: The buffer can be *mapped* on the CPU side in *read* mode (using @ref WGPUMapMode_Read).
entries.name: map_read

entries.doc:
The buffer can be *mapped* on the CPU side in *write* mode (using @ref WGPUMapMode_Write).

@note This usage is **not** required to set `mappedAtCreation` to `true` in @ref WGPUBufferDescriptor.
entries.name: map_write

entries.doc: The buffer can be used as the *source* of a GPU-side copy operation.
entries.name: copy_src

entries.doc: The buffer can be used as the *destination* of a GPU-side copy operation.
entries.name: copy_dst

entries.doc: The buffer can be used as an Index buffer when doing indexed drawing in a render pipeline.
entries.name: index

entries.doc: The buffer can be used as a Vertex buffer when using a render pipeline.
entries.name: vertex

entries.doc: The buffer can be bound to a shader as a uniform buffer.
entries.name: uniform

entries.doc: The buffer can be bound to a shader as a storage buffer.
entries.name: storage

entries.doc: The buffer can store arguments for an indirect draw call.
entries.name: indirect

entries.doc: The buffer can store the result of a timestamp or occlusion query.
entries.name: query_resolve

args.doc:
This argument contains multiple @ref ImplementationAllocatedStructChain roots.
Arbitrary chains must be handled gracefully by the application!
args.name: compilation_info

args.doc:
Pointer to the device which was lost. This is always a non-null pointer.
The pointed-to @ref WGPUDevice will be null if, and only if, either:
(1) The `reason` is @ref WGPUDeviceLostReason_FailedCreation.
(2) The last ref of the device has been (or is being) released: see @ref DeviceRelease.
args.name: device

args.doc: An error code explaining why the device was lost.
args.name: reason

args.doc: A @ref LocalizableHumanReadableMessageString describing why the device was lost.
args.name: message

args.doc:
The type of the error caught by the scope, or @ref WGPUErrorType_NoError if there was none.
If the `status` is not @ref WGPUPopErrorScopeStatus_Success, this is @ref WGPUErrorType_NoError.
args.name: type
message
message

Sentinel value used in @ref WGPUStringView to indicate that the pointer
is to a null-terminated string, rather than an explicitly-sized string.

constants.doc:

doc:
**Important:** *This documentation is a Work In Progress.*

This is the home of WebGPU C API specification. We define here the standard
`webgpu.h` header that all implementations should provide.

For all details where behavior is not otherwise specified, `webgpu.h` has
the same behavior as the WebGPU specification for JavaScript on the Web.
The WebIDL-based Web specification is mapped into C as faithfully (and
bidirectionally) as practical/possible.
The working draft of WebGPU can be found at <https://www.w3.org/TR/webgpu/>.

The standard include directive for this header is `#include <webgpu/webgpu.h>`
(if it is provided in a system-wide or toolchain-wide include directory).

entries.doc: Indicates no value is passed for this argument. See @ref SentinelValues.
entries.name: undefined

entries.doc: Indicates no value is passed for this argument. See @ref SentinelValues.
entries.name: undefined

entries.name: undefined

entries.name: undefined

entries.doc:
Indicates that this @ref WGPUBufferBindingLayout member of
its parent @ref WGPUBindGroupLayoutEntry is not used.
(See also @ref SentinelValues.)
entries.name: binding_not_used

entries.doc: `1`. Indicates no value is passed for this argument. See @ref SentinelValues.
entries.name: undefined

enums.doc: The callback mode controls how a callback for an asynchronous operation may be fired. See @ref Asynchronous-Operations for how these are used.

entries.doc:
Callbacks created with `WGPUCallbackMode_WaitAnyOnly`:
- fire when the asynchronous operation's future is passed to a call to @ref wgpuInstanceWaitAny
  AND the operation has already completed or it completes inside the call to @ref wgpuInstanceWaitAny.
entries.name: wait_any_only

entries.doc:
Callbacks created with `WGPUCallbackMode_AllowProcessEvents`:
- fire for the same reasons as callbacks created with `WGPUCallbackMode_WaitAnyOnly`
- fire inside a call to @ref wgpuInstanceProcessEvents if the asynchronous operation is complete.
entries.name: allow_process_events

entries.doc:
Callbacks created with `WGPUCallbackMode_AllowSpontaneous`:
- fire for the same reasons as callbacks created with `WGPUCallbackMode_AllowProcessEvents`
- **may** fire spontaneously on an arbitrary or application thread, when the WebGPU implementations discovers that the asynchronous operation is complete.

  Implementations _should_ fire spontaneous callbacks as soon as possible.

@note Because spontaneous callbacks may fire at an arbitrary time on an arbitrary thread, applications should take extra care when acquiring locks or mutating state inside the callback. It undefined behavior to re-entrantly call into the webgpu.h API if the callback fires while inside the callstack of another webgpu.h function that is not `wgpuInstanceWaitAny` or `wgpuInstanceProcessEvents`.
entries.name: allow_spontaneous

enums.name: callback_mode

entries.doc: Indicates no value is passed for this argument. See @ref SentinelValues.
entries.name: undefined

entries.doc: Indicates no value is passed for this argument. See @ref SentinelValues.
entries.name: undefined

entries.doc: Take its value from the red channel of the texture.
entries.name: r

entries.doc: Take its value from the green channel of the texture.
entries.name: g

entries.doc: Take its value from the blue channel of the texture.
entries.name: b

entries.doc: Take its value from the alpha channel of the texture.
entries.name: a

enums.doc: Describes how frames are composited with other contents on the screen when @ref wgpuSurfacePresent is called.

entries.doc: Lets the WebGPU implementation choose the best mode (supported, and with the best performance) between @ref WGPUCompositeAlphaMode_Opaque or @ref WGPUCompositeAlphaMode_Inherit.
entries.name: auto

entries.doc: The alpha component of the image is ignored and teated as if it is always 1.0.
entries.name: opaque

entries.doc: The alpha component is respected and non-alpha components are assumed to be already multiplied with the alpha component. For example, (0.5, 0, 0, 0.5) is semi-transparent bright red.
entries.name: premultiplied

entries.doc: The alpha component is respected and non-alpha components are assumed to NOT be already multiplied with the alpha component. For example, (1.0, 0, 0, 0.5) is semi-transparent bright red.
entries.name: unpremultiplied

entries.doc: The handling of the alpha component is unknown to WebGPU and should be handled by the application using system-specific APIs. This mode may be unavailable (for example on Wasm).
entries.name: inherit

enums.name: composite_alpha_mode

entries.doc: Indicates no value is passed for this argument. See @ref SentinelValues.
entries.name: undefined

entries.doc: Indicates no value is passed for this argument. See @ref SentinelValues.
entries.name: undefined

entries.doc: "Compatibility" profile which can be supported on OpenGL ES 3.1 and D3D11.
entries.name: compatibility

entries.doc: "Core" profile which can be supported on Vulkan/Metal/D3D12 (at least).
entries.name: core

entries.doc: Indicates no value is passed for this argument. See @ref SentinelValues.
entries.name: undefined

entries.doc: Indicates no value is passed for this argument. See @ref SentinelValues.

entries.doc:
Enable passing SPIR-V shaders to @ref wgpuDeviceCreateShaderModule,
via @ref WGPUShaderSourceSPIRV.
entries.name: shader_source_SPIRV

entries.doc:
Normally, a @ref WGPUAdapter can only create a single device. If this is
available and enabled, then adapters won't immediately expire when they
create a device, so can be reused to make multiple devices. They may
still expire for other reasons.
entries.name: multiple_devices_per_adapter

entries.doc: Indicates no value is passed for this argument. See @ref SentinelValues.
entries.name: undefined

entries.doc: Indicates no value is passed for this argument. See @ref SentinelValues.
entries.name: undefined

entries.doc: The error scope stack was successfully popped and a result was reported.
entries.name: success

entries.doc: The error scope stack could not be popped, because it was empty.
entries.name: error

enums.doc: Describes when and in which order frames are presented on the screen when @ref wgpuSurfacePresent is called.

entries.doc: Present mode is not specified. Use the default.
entries.name: undefined

entries.doc:
The presentation of the image to the user waits for the next vertical blanking period to update in a first-in, first-out manner.
Tearing cannot be observed and frame-loop will be limited to the display's refresh rate.
This is the only mode that's always available.
entries.name: fifo

entries.doc:
The presentation of the image to the user tries to wait for the next vertical blanking period but may decide to not wait if a frame is presented late.
Tearing can sometimes be observed but late-frame don't produce a full-frame stutter in the presentation.
This is still a first-in, first-out mechanism so a frame-loop will be limited to the display's refresh rate.
entries.name: fifo_relaxed

entries.doc:
The presentation of the image to the user is updated immediately without waiting for a vertical blank.
Tearing can be observed but latency is minimized.
entries.name: immediate

entries.doc:
The presentation of the image to the user waits for the next vertical blanking period to update to the latest provided image.
Tearing cannot be observed and a frame-loop is not limited to the display's refresh rate.
entries.name: mailbox

enums.name: present_mode

There was some deterministic error. (Note this is currently never used,

entries.doc: Yay! Everything is good and we can render this frame.
entries.name: success_optimal

entries.doc: Still OK - the surface can present the frame, but in a suboptimal way. The surface may need reconfiguration.
entries.name: success_suboptimal

entries.doc: Some operation timed out while trying to acquire the frame.
entries.name: timeout

entries.doc: The surface is too different to be used, compared to when it was originally created.
entries.name: outdated

entries.doc: The connection to whatever owns the surface was lost, or generally needs to be fully reinitialized.
entries.name: lost

entries.doc: There was some deterministic error (for example, the surface is not configured, or there was an @ref OutStructChainError). Should produce @ref ImplementationDefinedLogging containing details.
entries.name: error

The call was invalid for some reason (see @ref Wait-Any).
Should produce @ref ImplementationDefinedLogging containing details.

args.doc: Byte offset relative to beginning of the buffer.
args.name: offset

args.doc:
Byte size of the region to map.
If this is @ref WGPU_WHOLE_MAP_SIZE, it defaults to `buffer.size - offset`.
args.name: size

args.doc: Byte offset relative to the beginning of the buffer.
args.name: offset

args.doc:
Byte size of the range to get.
If this is @ref WGPU_WHOLE_MAP_SIZE, it defaults to `buffer.size - offset`.
The returned pointer is valid for exactly this many bytes.
args.name: size

methods.doc:
Returns a mutable pointer to beginning of the mapped range.
See @ref MappedRangeBehavior for error conditions and guarantees.
This function is safe to call inside spontaneous callbacks (see @ref CallbackReentrancy).

In Wasm, if `memcpy`ing into this range, prefer using @ref wgpuBufferWriteMappedRange
instead for better performance.
methods.name: get_mapped_range

args.doc: Byte offset relative to the beginning of the buffer.
args.name: offset

args.doc:
Byte size of the range to get.
If this is @ref WGPU_WHOLE_MAP_SIZE, it defaults to `buffer.size - offset`.
The returned pointer is valid for exactly this many bytes.
args.name: size

methods.doc:
Returns a const pointer to beginning of the mapped range.
It must not be written; writing to this range causes undefined behavior.
See @ref MappedRangeBehavior for error conditions and guarantees.
This function is safe to call inside spontaneous callbacks (see @ref CallbackReentrancy).

In Wasm, if `memcpy`ing from this range, prefer using @ref wgpuBufferReadMappedRange
instead for better performance.
methods.name: get_const_mapped_range

args.doc: Byte offset relative to the beginning of the buffer.
args.name: offset

args.doc: Destination, to read buffer data into.
args.name: data

args.doc:
Number of bytes of data to read from the buffer.
(Note @ref WGPU_WHOLE_MAP_SIZE is *not* accepted here.)
args.name: size

methods.doc:
Copies a range of data from the buffer mapping into the provided destination pointer.
See @ref MappedRangeBehavior for error conditions and guarantees.
This function is safe to call inside spontaneous callbacks (see @ref CallbackReentrancy).

In Wasm, this is more efficient than copying from a mapped range into a `malloc`'d range.
methods.name: read_mapped_range

returns.doc: @ref WGPUStatus_Error if the copy did not occur.

args.doc: Byte offset relative to the beginning of the buffer.
args.name: offset

args.doc: Source, to write buffer data from.
args.name: data

args.doc:
Number of bytes of data to write to the buffer.
(Note @ref WGPU_WHOLE_MAP_SIZE is *not* accepted here.)
args.name: size

methods.doc:
Copies a range of data from the provided source pointer into the buffer mapping.
See @ref MappedRangeBehavior for error conditions and guarantees.
This function is safe to call inside spontaneous callbacks (see @ref CallbackReentrancy).

In Wasm, this is more efficient than copying from a `malloc`'d range into a mapped range.
methods.name: write_mapped_range

returns.doc: @ref WGPUStatus_Error if the copy did not occur.

methods.doc:
Configures parameters for rendering to `surface`.
Produces a @ref DeviceError for all content-timeline errors defined by the WebGPU specification.

See @ref Surface-Configuration for more details.
methods.name: configure

args.doc: The @ref WGPUAdapter to get capabilities for presenting to this @ref WGPUSurface.
args.name: adapter

args.doc:
The structure to fill capabilities in.
It may contain memory allocations so @ref wgpuSurfaceCapabilitiesFreeMembers must be called to avoid memory leaks.

Provides information on how `adapter` is able to use `surface`.
See @ref Surface-Capabilities for more details.

returns.doc: Indicates if there was an @ref OutStructChainError.

methods.doc:
Returns the @ref WGPUTexture to render to `surface` this frame along with metadata on the frame.
Returns `NULL` and @ref WGPUSurfaceGetCurrentTextureStatus_Error if the surface is not configured.

See @ref Surface-Presenting for more details.
methods.name: get_current_texture

methods.doc:
Shows `surface`'s current texture to the user.
See @ref Surface-Presenting for more details.
methods.name: present

returns.doc: Returns @ref WGPUStatus_Error if the surface doesn't have a current texture.

methods.doc:
Removes the configuration for `surface`.
See @ref Surface-Configuration for more details.
methods.name: unconfigure

methods.doc: Modifies the label used to refer to `surface`.
methods.name: set_label

members.doc: Binding index in the bind group.
members.name: binding

members.doc:
Set this if the binding is a buffer object.
Otherwise must be null.
members.name: buffer

members.doc:
If the binding is a buffer, this is the byte offset of the binding range.
Otherwise ignored.
members.name: offset

members.doc:
If the binding is a buffer, this is the byte size of the binding range
(@ref WGPU_WHOLE_SIZE means the binding ends at the end of the buffer).
Otherwise ignored.
members.name: size

members.doc:
Set this if the binding is a sampler object.
Otherwise must be null.
members.name: sampler

members.doc:
Set this if the binding is a texture view object.
Otherwise must be null.
members.name: texture_view

members.doc: If non-zero, this entry defines a binding array with this size.
members.name: binding_array_size

If set to @ref WGPUBlendOperation_Undefined,
[defaults](@ref SentinelValues) to @ref WGPUBlendOperation_Add.

If set to @ref WGPUBlendFactor_Undefined,
[defaults](@ref SentinelValues) to @ref WGPUBlendFactor_One.

If set to @ref WGPUBlendFactor_Undefined,
[defaults](@ref SentinelValues) to @ref WGPUBlendFactor_Zero.

members.doc:
If set to @ref WGPUBufferBindingType_Undefined,
[defaults](@ref SentinelValues) to @ref WGPUBufferBindingType_Uniform.

members.doc:
When true, the buffer is mapped in write mode at creation. It should thus be unmapped once its initial data has been written.

@note Mapping at creation does **not** require the usage @ref WGPUBufferUsage_MapWrite.
members.name: mapped_at_creation

structs.doc:
An RGBA color. Represents a `f32`, `i32`, or `u32` color using @ref DoubleAsSupertype.

If any channel is non-finite, produces a @ref NonFiniteFloatValueError.
structs.name: color

members.doc:
The texture format of the target. If @ref WGPUTextureFormat_Undefined,
indicates a "hole" in the parent @ref WGPUFragmentState `targets` array:
the pipeline does not output a value at this `location`.
members.name: format

members.doc: Line number where the message is attached, starting at 1.
members.name: line_num

members.doc: Offset in UTF-8 code units (bytes) from the beginning of the line, starting at 1.
members.name: line_pos

members.doc: Offset in UTF-8 code units (bytes) from the beginning of the shader code, starting at 0.
members.name: offset

members.doc: Length in UTF-8 code units (bytes) of the span the message corresponds to.
members.name: length

members.doc:
Represents a WGSL numeric or boolean value using @ref DoubleAsSupertype.

If non-finite, produces a @ref NonFiniteFloatValueError.
members.name: value

members.doc:
TODO

If non-finite, produces a @ref NonFiniteFloatValueError.

members.doc:
TODO

If non-finite, produces a @ref NonFiniteFloatValueError.
members.name: depth_bias_clamp

members.doc:
Called when there is an uncaptured error on this device, from any thread.
See @ref ErrorScopes.

**Important:** This callback does not have a configurable @ref WGPUCallbackMode; it may be called at any time (like @ref WGPUCallbackMode_AllowSpontaneous). As such, calls into the `webgpu.h` API from this callback are unsafe. See @ref CallbackReentrancy.
members.name: uncaptured_error_callback_info

structs.doc: Chained in an @ref WGPUBindGroupEntry to set it to an @ref WGPUExternalTexture. This must have a corresponding @ref WGPUExternalTextureBindingLayout in the @ref WGPUBindGroupLayout.
structs.name: external_texture_binding_entry

structs.doc: Chained in @ref WGPUBindGroupLayoutEntry to specify that the corresponding entries in an @ref WGPUBindGroup will contain an @ref WGPUExternalTexture.
structs.name: external_texture_binding_layout

structs.doc: Opaque handle to an asynchronous operation. See @ref Asynchronous-Operations for more information.

If `NULL`, indicates a hole in the parent
@ref WGPURenderPassDescriptor::colorAttachments array.

members.doc:
This is a @ref NullableFloatingPointType.

If `NaN`, indicates an `undefined` value (as defined by the JS spec).
Use @ref WGPU_DEPTH_CLEAR_VALUE_UNDEFINED to indicate this semantically.

If infinite, produces a @ref NonFiniteFloatValueError.
members.name: depth_clear_value

members.doc:
"Feature level" for the adapter request. If an adapter is returned, it must support the features and limits in the requested feature level.

If set to @ref WGPUFeatureLevel_Undefined,
[defaults](@ref SentinelValues) to @ref WGPUFeatureLevel_Core.
Additionally, implementations may ignore @ref WGPUFeatureLevel_Compatibility
and provide @ref WGPUFeatureLevel_Core instead.
members.name: feature_level

members.doc:
If true, requires the adapter to be a "fallback" adapter as defined by the JS spec.
If this is not possible, the request returns null.
members.name: force_fallback_adapter

members.doc:
If set, requires the adapter to have a particular backend type.
If this is not possible, the request returns null.
members.name: backend_type

members.doc:
If set, requires the adapter to be able to output to a particular surface.
If this is not possible, the request returns null.
members.name: compatible_surface

structs.doc: Extension providing requestAdapter options for implementations with WebXR interop (i.e. Wasm).

members.doc: Sets the `xrCompatible` option in the JS API.
members.name: xr_compatible

structs.name: request_adapter_WebXR_options

members.doc:
If set to @ref WGPUSamplerBindingType_Undefined,
[defaults](@ref SentinelValues) to @ref WGPUSamplerBindingType_Filtering.
members.name: type

members.doc:
If set to @ref WGPUAddressMode_Undefined,
[defaults](@ref SentinelValues) to @ref WGPUAddressMode_ClampToEdge.
members.name: address_mode_u

members.doc:
If set to @ref WGPUAddressMode_Undefined,
[defaults](@ref SentinelValues) to @ref WGPUAddressMode_ClampToEdge.
members.name: address_mode_v

members.doc:
If set to @ref WGPUAddressMode_Undefined,
[defaults](@ref SentinelValues) to @ref WGPUAddressMode_ClampToEdge.
members.name: address_mode_w

members.doc:
If set to @ref WGPUFilterMode_Undefined,
[defaults](@ref SentinelValues) to @ref WGPUFilterMode_Nearest.
members.name: mag_filter

members.doc:
If set to @ref WGPUFilterMode_Undefined,
[defaults](@ref SentinelValues) to @ref WGPUFilterMode_Nearest.
members.name: min_filter

members.doc:
If set to @ref WGPUFilterMode_Undefined,
[defaults](@ref SentinelValues) to @ref WGPUMipmapFilterMode_Nearest.
members.name: mipmap_filter

members.doc:
TODO

If non-finite, produces a @ref NonFiniteFloatValueError.
members.name: lod_min_clamp

members.doc:
TODO

If non-finite, produces a @ref NonFiniteFloatValueError.
members.name: lod_max_clamp

members.doc:
If set to @ref WGPUCompareFunction_Undefined,
[defaults](@ref SentinelValues) to @ref WGPUCompareFunction_Always.
members.name: compare

members.doc:
If set to @ref WGPUStencilOperation_Undefined,
[defaults](@ref SentinelValues) to @ref WGPUStencilOperation_Keep.
members.name: fail_op

members.doc:
If set to @ref WGPUStencilOperation_Undefined,
[defaults](@ref SentinelValues) to @ref WGPUStencilOperation_Keep.
members.name: depth_fail_op

members.doc:
If set to @ref WGPUStencilOperation_Undefined,
[defaults](@ref SentinelValues) to @ref WGPUStencilOperation_Keep.
members.name: pass_op

members.doc:
If set to @ref WGPUStorageTextureAccess_Undefined,
[defaults](@ref SentinelValues) to @ref WGPUStorageTextureAccess_WriteOnly.
members.name: access

members.doc:
If set to @ref WGPUTextureViewDimension_Undefined,
[defaults](@ref SentinelValues) to @ref WGPUTextureViewDimension_2D.
members.name: view_dimension

structs.doc: Filled by @ref wgpuSurfaceGetCapabilities with what's supported for @ref wgpuSurfaceConfigure for a pair of @ref WGPUSurface and @ref WGPUAdapter.

members.doc:
The bit set of supported @ref WGPUTextureUsage bits.
Guaranteed to contain @ref WGPUTextureUsage_RenderAttachment.
members.name: usages

members.doc: A list of supported @ref WGPUTextureFormat values, in order of preference.
members.name: formats

members.doc:
A list of supported @ref WGPUPresentMode values.
Guaranteed to contain @ref WGPUPresentMode_Fifo.
members.name: present_modes

members.doc:
A list of supported @ref WGPUCompositeAlphaMode values.
@ref WGPUCompositeAlphaMode_Auto will be an alias for the first element and will never be present in this array.
members.name: alpha_modes

structs.name: surface_capabilities

structs.doc: Extension of @ref WGPUSurfaceConfiguration for color spaces and HDR.
structs.name: surface_color_management

structs.doc:
Options to @ref wgpuSurfaceConfigure for defining how a @ref WGPUSurface will be rendered to and presented to the user.
See @ref Surface-Configuration for more details.

members.doc: The @ref WGPUDevice to use to render to surface's textures.
members.name: device

members.doc: The @ref WGPUTextureFormat of the surface's textures.
members.name: format

members.doc: The @ref WGPUTextureUsage of the surface's textures.
members.name: usage

members.doc: The width of the surface's textures.
members.name: width

members.doc: The height of the surface's textures.
members.name: height

members.doc: The additional @ref WGPUTextureFormat for @ref WGPUTextureView format reinterpretation of the surface's textures.
members.name: view_formats

members.doc:
How the surface's frames will be composited on the screen.

If set to @ref WGPUCompositeAlphaMode_Auto,
[defaults] to @ref WGPUCompositeAlphaMode_Inherit in native (allowing the mode
to be configured externally), and to @ref WGPUCompositeAlphaMode_Opaque in Wasm.
members.name: alpha_mode

members.doc:
When and in which order the surface's frames will be shown on the screen.

If set to @ref WGPUPresentMode_Undefined,
[defaults](@ref SentinelValues) to @ref WGPUPresentMode_Fifo.
members.name: present_mode

structs.name: surface_configuration

structs.doc:
The root descriptor for the creation of an @ref WGPUSurface with @ref wgpuInstanceCreateSurface.
It isn't sufficient by itself and must have one of the `WGPUSurfaceSource*` in its chain.
See @ref Surface-Creation for more details.

members.doc: Label used to refer to the object.
members.name: label

structs.name: surface_descriptor

structs.doc: Chained in @ref WGPUSurfaceDescriptor to make an @ref WGPUSurface wrapping an Android [`ANativeWindow`](https://developer.android.com/ndk/reference/group/a-native-window).

members.doc: The pointer to the [`ANativeWindow`](https://developer.android.com/ndk/reference/group/a-native-window) that will be wrapped by the @ref WGPUSurface.
members.name: window

structs.name: surface_source_android_native_window

structs.doc: Chained in @ref WGPUSurfaceDescriptor to make an @ref WGPUSurface wrapping a [`CAMetalLayer`](https://developer.apple.com/documentation/quartzcore/cametallayer?language=objc).

members.doc: The pointer to the [`CAMetalLayer`](https://developer.apple.com/documentation/quartzcore/cametallayer?language=objc) that will be wrapped by the @ref WGPUSurface.
members.name: layer

structs.name: surface_source_metal_layer

structs.doc: Chained in @ref WGPUSurfaceDescriptor to make an @ref WGPUSurface wrapping a [Wayland](https://wayland.freedesktop.org/) [`wl_surface`](https://wayland.freedesktop.org/docs/html/apa.html#protocol-spec-wl_surface).

members.doc: A [`wl_surface`](https://wayland.freedesktop.org/docs/html/apa.html#protocol-spec-wl_surface) that will be wrapped by the @ref WGPUSurface
members.name: surface

structs.name: surface_source_wayland_surface

structs.doc: Chained in @ref WGPUSurfaceDescriptor to make an @ref WGPUSurface wrapping a Windows [`HWND`](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/apps/develop/ui-input/retrieve-hwnd).

members.doc:
The [`HINSTANCE`](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/learnwin32/winmain--the-application-entry-point) for this application.
Most commonly `GetModuleHandle(nullptr)`.
members.name: hinstance

members.doc: The [`HWND`](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/apps/develop/ui-input/retrieve-hwnd) that will be wrapped by the @ref WGPUSurface.
members.name: hwnd

structs.name: surface_source_windows_HWND

structs.doc: Chained in @ref WGPUSurfaceDescriptor to make an @ref WGPUSurface wrapping an [XCB](https://xcb.freedesktop.org/) `xcb_window_t`.

members.doc: The `xcb_connection_t` for the connection to the X server.
members.name: connection

members.doc: The `xcb_window_t` for the window that will be wrapped by the @ref WGPUSurface.
members.name: window

structs.name: surface_source_XCB_window

structs.doc: Chained in @ref WGPUSurfaceDescriptor to make an @ref WGPUSurface wrapping an [Xlib](https://www.x.org/releases/current/doc/libX11/libX11/libX11.html) `Window`.

members.doc: A pointer to the [`Display`](https://www.x.org/releases/current/doc/libX11/libX11/libX11.html#Opening_the_Display) connected to the X server.
members.name: display

members.doc: The [`Window`](https://www.x.org/releases/current/doc/libX11/libX11/libX11.html#Creating_Windows) that will be wrapped by the @ref WGPUSurface.
members.name: window

structs.name: surface_source_xlib_window

structs.doc:
Queried each frame from a @ref WGPUSurface to get a @ref WGPUTexture to render to along with some metadata.
See @ref Surface-Presenting for more details.

members.doc:
The @ref WGPUTexture representing the frame that will be shown on the surface.
It is @ref ReturnedWithOwnership from @ref wgpuSurfaceGetCurrentTexture.
members.name: texture

members.doc: Whether the call to @ref wgpuSurfaceGetCurrentTexture succeeded and a hint as to why it might not have.
members.name: status

structs.name: surface_texture

members.doc:
If set to @ref WGPUTextureAspect_Undefined,
[defaults](@ref SentinelValues) to @ref WGPUTextureAspect_All.
members.name: aspect

members.doc:
If set to @ref WGPUTextureSampleType_Undefined,
[defaults](@ref SentinelValues) to @ref WGPUTextureSampleType_Float.
members.name: sample_type

members.doc:
If set to @ref WGPUTextureViewDimension_Undefined,
[defaults](@ref SentinelValues) to @ref WGPUTextureViewDimension_2D.
members.name: view_dimension

structs.doc:
When accessed by a shader, the red/green/blue/alpha channels are replaced
by the value corresponding to the component specified in r, g, b, and a,
respectively unlike the JS API which uses a string of length four, with
each character mapping to the texture view's red/green/blue/alpha channels.

members.doc:
The value that replaces the red channel in the shader.

If set to @ref WGPUComponentSwizzle_Undefined,
[defaults](@ref SentinelValues) to @ref WGPUComponentSwizzle_R.
members.name: r

members.doc:
The value that replaces the green channel in the shader.

If set to @ref WGPUComponentSwizzle_Undefined,
[defaults](@ref SentinelValues) to @ref WGPUComponentSwizzle_G.
members.name: g

members.doc:
The value that replaces the blue channel in the shader.

If set to @ref WGPUComponentSwizzle_Undefined,
[defaults](@ref SentinelValues) to @ref WGPUComponentSwizzle_B.
members.name: b

members.doc:
The value that replaces the alpha channel in the shader.

If set to @ref WGPUComponentSwizzle_Undefined,
[defaults](@ref SentinelValues) to @ref WGPUComponentSwizzle_A.
members.name: a

structs.name: texture_component_swizzle

members.doc:
If set to @ref WGPUTextureDimension_Undefined,
[defaults](@ref SentinelValues) to @ref WGPUTextureDimension_2D.
members.name: dimension

members.doc:
If set to @ref WGPUTextureAspect_Undefined,
[defaults](@ref SentinelValues) to @ref WGPUTextureAspect_All.
members.name: aspect

structs.doc:
If `attributes` is empty *and* `stepMode` is @ref WGPUVertexStepMode_Undefined,
indicates a "hole" in the parent @ref WGPUVertexState `buffers` array,
with behavior equivalent to `null` in the JS API.

If `attributes` is empty but `stepMode` is *not* @ref WGPUVertexStepMode_Undefined,
indicates a vertex buffer with no attributes, with behavior equivalent to
`{ attributes: [] }` in the JS API. (TODO: If the JS API changes not to
distinguish these cases, then this distinction doesn't matter and we can
remove this documentation.)

If `stepMode` is @ref WGPUVertexStepMode_Undefined but `attributes` is *not* empty,
`stepMode` [defaults](@ref SentinelValues) to @ref WGPUVertexStepMode_Vertex.
structs.name: vertex_buffer_layout
